On Wed, 2003-04-09 at 15:52, Sandy McArthur wrote:

In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
> > 1. Cannot deliver without tests, so your delivery is bloated

> I don't belive that to be true but maybe I'm missing something. In the
> following code you can delete the Foo$Test.class file and the `java
> Foo` still works which means a `find src/ -name '*$Test.class' | xargs
> rm ` would remove the test cases from your final product.

Oops... sorry, you are absolutely correct.

> > 3. Automated suite generation is more difficult
> I have created a test ant build script with an junit task that matches
> "*$Test".

Ahhh, the power of RegEx.

> The inner class method keeps everything together which is appealing,
> though it may not be logically consistant. I'm curious where it breaks
> down negativly.

Given your arguments above, it doesn't break down negatively.
